narration.utterances: Everyone knows that the elephant has a very long nose

text.sentence: Everyone knows that the elephant has a very long nose.

narration.utterances: But a long time ago the elephant's nose was short and fat

text.sentence: But a long time ago, the elephant's nose was short and fat.

narration.utterances: Like a shoe in the middle of its face

text.sentence: Like a shoe in the middle of its face.

narration.utterances: One day a baby elephant was born

text.sentence: One day a baby elephant was born.

narration.utterances: She was curious about everything

text.sentence: She was curious about everything.

narration.utterances: She had a question for every animal

text.sentence: She had a question for every animal.

narration.utterances: She was curious about Giraffe

text.sentence: She was curious about Giraffe.

narration.utterances: Why do you have a long neck
she asked

text.sentence: "Why do you have a long neck?" she asked.

narration.utterances: She was curious about Rhino

text.sentence: She was curious about Rhino.

narration.utterances: Why does your horn have a sharp point

text.sentence: "Why does your horn have a sharp point?"

narration.utterances: She was curious about Hippo

text.sentence: She was curious about Hippo.

narration.utterances: Why do you have red eyes
she asked

text.sentence: "Why do you have red eyes?" she asked.

narration.utterances: And she was VERY curious about Crocodile

text.sentence: And she was VERY curious about Crocodile.

narration.utterances: What does Crocodile eat for dinner
she asked

text.sentence: "What does Crocodile eat for dinner?" she asked.

narration.utterances: Never ask a question like that
said her mother

text.sentence: "Never ask a question like that!" said her mother.

narration.utterances: Then she walked off frowning

text.sentence: Then she walked off, frowning.

narration.utterances: Quickly Crow flew down to baby elephant

text.sentence: Quickly Crow flew down to baby elephant.

narration.utterances: Follow me to the river

text.sentence: "Follow me to the river.

narration.utterances: There you will see what Crocodile eats for dinner squawked Crow

text.sentence: There you will see what Crocodile eats for dinner," squawked Crow.

narration.utterances: So the baby elephant followed Crow down to the river

text.sentence: So the baby elephant followed Crow down to the river.

narration.utterances: She pushed through the reeds and stood on the bank

text.sentence: She pushed through the reeds and stood on the bank.

narration.utterances: She looked into the water

text.sentence: She looked into the water.

narration.utterances: Where was Crocodile

text.sentence: Where was Crocodile?

narration.utterances: Hello said a stone near the river bank

text.sentence: "Hello," said a stone near the river bank.

narration.utterances: Hello said Baby Elephant

text.sentence: "Hello," said Baby Elephant.

narration.utterances: Can you tell me what Crocodile eats for dinner
she asked

text.sentence: "Can you tell me what Crocodile eats for dinner?" she asked.

narration.utterances: Bend down and I will tell you said the stone

text.sentence: "Bend down and I will tell you," said the stone.

narration.utterances: Lower lower said the stone

text.sentence: "Lower, lower," said the stone.

narration.utterances: So Baby Elephant bent down lower and lower

text.sentence: So Baby Elephant bent down lower, and lower.

narration.utterances: Then suddenly Snap

text.sentence: Then suddenly, "Snap!"

narration.utterances: Baby Elephant's nose was caught in Crocodile's jaws

text.sentence: Baby Elephant's nose was caught in Crocodile's jaws.

narration.utterances: Crocodile will eat you for dinner
squawked Crow and flew away

text.sentence: "Crocodile will eat you for dinner!" squawked Crow, and flew away.

narration.utterances: Baby Elephant sat back on her strong legs and pulled

text.sentence: Baby Elephant sat back on her strong legs and pulled.

narration.utterances: She pulled and pulled

text.sentence: She pulled, and pulled.

narration.utterances: But Crocodile did not let go of her nose

text.sentence: But Crocodile did not let go of her nose.

narration.utterances: Baby Elephant's nose stretched and stretched and stretched

text.sentence: Baby Elephant's nose stretched, and stretched, and stretched.

narration.utterances: Then Thud
she fell on her back

text.sentence: Then, "Thud!" she fell on her back.

narration.utterances: Crocodile sunk back into the water

text.sentence: Crocodile sunk back into the water.

narration.utterances: He was cross about losing his dinner

text.sentence: He was cross about losing his dinner.

narration.utterances: Baby Elephant looked at her nose

text.sentence: Baby Elephant looked at her nose.

narration.utterances: It was stretched very long

text.sentence: It was stretched very long.

narration.utterances: She could not see where it ended

text.sentence: She could not see where it ended!

narration.utterances: Her nose was so long she could pick fruit from high branches

text.sentence: Her nose was so long she could pick fruit from high branches.

narration.utterances: Her nose was so long she could shower her back with water

text.sentence: Her nose was so long she could shower her back with water.

narration.utterances: From that day all elephants had long and useful trunks

text.sentence: From that day, all elephants had long and useful trunks.
